Description: Brunswick agreed to pay $1 million to settle allegations that it failed to report, in a timely manner, 31 serious incidents involving defective forks on its bicycles.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2003/Commission-Levies-15-Million-In-Penalties-

Description: The Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs reached an agreement with federal contractor Lund Boat Co., a wholly owned subsidiary of the Brunswick Corp., settling allegations of hiring discrimination. In a consent judgment approved by the department's Office of Administrative Law Judges, Brunswick Corp. and Lund Boat Co. agreed to pay $295,000 in back wages and interest to 185 female job applicants who were rejected for entry-level positions at Lund's boat manufacturing plant in New York Mills, Minn.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/opa/media/press/ofccp/OFCCP20121709.htm

Description: Cybex International agreed to pay a $7.95 million civil penalty to resolve allegations that it failed to immediately report to CPSC that its Arm Curl and Smith Press Machines contained a defect or created an unreasonable risk of serious injury.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2021/Cybex-Agrees-to-Pay-7-95-Million-Civil-Penalty-for-Failure-to-Report-Serious-Injuries-Involving-its-Exercise-Equipment
